sections.content:
| Criteria       | Monocrystalline Panels | Polycrystalline Panels | Tandem Solar Cells |
|-----------------------|------------------------|------------------------|---------------------|
| Energy Efficiency (%) | 22           | 19           | 25         |
| Installation Costs ($) | 4,500         | 3,800         | 6,000        |
| Price per Watt ($)  | 3.00          | 2.50          | 3.50        |
| Upkeep Costs (%)   | 0.5          | 0.8          | 0.3         |
| Return on Investment (%) | 12         | 10           | 15         |
| Lifespan (years)    | 25          | 20           | 30         |
| Warranty Period (years)| 10          | 5           | 15         |

Notes:
1. Energy Efficiency (%): The percentage of sunlight converted into electricity.
2. Installation Costs ($): The estimated cost of installing a solar panel system per watt.
3. Price per Watt ($):The cost of the solar panels per watt of capacity.
4. Upkeep Costs (%): Annual maintenance costs as a percentage of the initial installation cost.
5. Return on Investment (%): The percentage return on the initial investment over the system's lifespan.
6. Lifespan (years): The expected operational lifespan of the solar panels.
7. Warranty Period (years): The manufacturer's warranty period for the solar panels.

Please replace the values in this table with accurate and up-to-date information based on your research or specific product details. Additionally, you may want to include additional criteria based on your project's requirements.
